Entity Names

Lesson
objectives

Describe the role of entity names in Guidewire
applications

Distinguish between the entity name file and
entity name types

Create and modify entity names using the
Entity Name editor

Reference entity name types

Entity names

| Entity name G&G

« Anentity name user interface friendly name for an instance of a given entity
« Anentity name file contains at least one default entity name type definition
¢ Default definition always accessible with the entity DisplayName property

* anAddress.DisplayName

* anABCompany .DisplayName

* anABContact.DisplayName

* aContactNote.DisplayName

* aEFTDate.DisplayName

| Example: ContactNote entity name a

¢ The entity name defines a function that

calculates the UI friendly name for the
given instance

¢ The use of entity names improves the
overall application performance

BicontactNoteen x

a
Name Entity Path

CreateTime ContactNote.CreateTime

Body ContactNote Body

return CreateTime + ": (no body text)"

} else {
return CreateTime + ": " + Body.elide(35)

original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Question G

_- — Foran ABPerson object, name an example of when the object's entity
¢ name might appear in the user interface.

¢
¢

ee ee a

Answer [a

_- — Foran ABPerson object, name an example of when the object's entity
¢ name might appear in the user interface.

¢
¢

Possible answers: a drop-down list that displays a list of ABPersons; an info bar
widget with a value property set to the ABPerson's DisplayName.

SOOO ODD DOOD DODO DOOD

Question G

_— — What property points to an object's default entity name type?
4

¢
¢

ee ee a

Answer

_— — What property points to an object's default entity name type?
4

¢
¢

DisplayName

SOOO ODD DOOD DODO DOOD

Question G

_— — For which entities do you need to create an entity name file?

4
¢
¢

ee ee a

Answer [a

_— — For which entities do you need to create an entity name file?

4
¢
¢

Custom entities and other entities whose display names are referenced in the user
interface but do not already have entity names.

SOOO ODD DOOD DODO DOOD

Question G

_— — What must you do to deploy new entity name types or changes to
ie existing entity name types?

¢

ee ee a

Answer [a

_— — What must you do to deploy new entity name types or changes to
A existing entity name types?

¢

You must restart the server.

SOOO ODD DOOD DODO DOOD
